PARAGRAPH.STRING: (ˈpjœr̥k ˈkvʏðmʏnstoʊhtɪr) (born November 21, 1965 in Reykjavík, Iceland) is a Brit Award-winning Icelandic singer/songwriter and composer (formerly the lead singer of alternative rock band The Sugarcubes), with a great expressive range and an interest in many kinds of music including pop, alternative rock, jazz, ambient music, electronica, folk, and classical music.
innovative music videos and individualistic music.
record label, One Little Indian, reported in 2003 that
has sold over 15 million albums worldwide.
